newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: MIM awards A$20 mln contract for new mine.
newsitem.headline: MIM awards A$20 mln contract for new mine.

text.p: MIM Holdings Ltd said on Friday it had awarded a A$20 million contract to unlisted Australian mining contractor for the construction of an internal shaft at its Enterprise copper mine project in Queensland.
MIM said the shaft sinking was expected to take just over 12 months, with completion targeted for June 30, 1998.
The Enterprise mine development was part of MIM's A$500 million expansion of its copper business, which was expected to lengthen the life of the Mount Isa copper operations by another 20 years.
The mine was expected to start production by the end of 1999 and produce about 120,000 tonnes of copper metal annually.
